title: Vaiden Field Airport
text:
Vaiden Field Airport is a public-use <a href="airport">airport</a> located eight <a href="nautical%20mile">nautical mile</a>s (9 <a href="mile">mi</a>, 15 <a href="kilometre">km</a>) southwest of the <a href="central%20business%20district">central business district</a> of <a href="Marion%2C%20Alabama">Marion</a>, in the community of <a href="Vaiden%2C%20Alabama">Vaiden</a>, <a href="Perry%20County%2C%20Alabama">Perry County</a>, <a href="Alabama">Alabama</a>, <a href="United%20States">United States</a>. It is owned by the Perry County Airport and Industrial Authority.
Viaden Airfield was constructed to serve as an auxiliary airfield for Craig Air Force Base near Selma, Alabama. At that time it had 8000 feet of runway and was used for touch-and-go landings for T-38 aircraft. Runway supervisors drove from Craig AFB to direct flight operations.
Facilities and aircraft.
Vaiden Field Airport covers an area of 480 <a href="acre">acre</a>s (194 <a href="hectare">ha</a>) at an <a href="elevation">elevation</a> of 225 feet (69 m) above <a href="mean%20sea%20level">mean sea level</a>. It has one <a href="runway">runway</a> designated 16/34 with an <a href="asphalt">asphalt</a> surface measuring 6,377 by 80 feet (1,944 x 24 m). For the 12-month period ending October 8, 2010, the airport had 2,071 <a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a> aircraft operations, an average of 172 per month.
In December 2008 a new lighting system was installed including beacon, runway lights and signs, segmented windcone, <a href="Precision%20approach%20path%20indicator">PAPIs</a> (not certified as of April 2009) and electrical vault. The runway was also resurfaced.
